intro: Scribneria bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's scribneria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the western United States. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
